Reviews.Title: Top Performer!
Reviews.Author: Falconcc
Reviews.Content: The Amazon price was the best available at the time of my purchase. Combine that with free shipping and this is a really great deal for those who want a GSM phone that has a decent camera, is simple to use, and has a reasonably small form factor. I am using mine on the AT&T; network currently. I was previously using a Sony Ericsson W518a, which had been giving me a multitude of problems. I wanted a simple, unlocked phone that would work with my voice and text plan, but I didn't want to go backwards in camera resolution or expandable memory capabilities. Additionally, I did not want to renew my contract with an upgrade from AT&T; (Just in case I want to switch carriers in the near future). I don't have a data plan and pretty much only talk and text from my device. This phone does both very well. The reception and voice clarity are superior to that of my previous Sony Ericsson. The Nokia interface is not as aesthetically refined as the Sony Ericsson was, but it is simple and reliable. I will take functionality over beauty if I have to choose between the two. Some nice extras are the inclusion of a 3.5 mm audio jack and a micro USB port which can be used for charging and data transfers (I hate proprietary jacks!). The only problems I had were in configuring the MMS, Internet, and MEdia Net settings. Since this phone has never been sold by AT&T;, they won't provide any technical support. However, once I found some instructions for the configuration, it was easy to get all features running smoothly. This was a great buy. Here is what you have to do to get the MMS and internet connected:Menu-Messaging--Message settings---Multimedia messagesReq read reports - NoAllow read report - NoMMS creation mode - GuidedDefault slide timing - 00:08MMS reception - AutomaticAllow adverts - No----Configuration settingsConfiguration - Personal config.Account - MEdia Net-Settings--Connectivity---Packet dataPacket data conn. - When needed----Packet data settingsActive access point - Access point 1-----Edit active access pt.Alias for access point - Access point 1Packet data acc. pt. - wap.cingular--Configuration---Personal config. sett.Options-Add new - access point-Account name - My access point-Access point settings-Bearer settings-Packet data acc. pt. - wap.cingular-Network type - IPv4-Authentication type - Secure-User name - (leave blank)-Password - (leave blank)--Configuration-Default config. sett. - Personal config. (checked)-Act. def. in all apps. - Yes-Preferred access point - My access point-Personal config. sett.--MEdia Net-Account Name - MEdia Net-Server address - [...]-Use pref access point - No---Access point settings-Proxy - Enabled-Proxy address - [...]-Proxy port - 80----Bearer settings-Packet data acc. pt. - wap.cingular-Network type - IPv4-Authentication type - Secure-User name - (leave blank)-Password - (leave blank)

Reviews.Title: It is a great phone, simple as it!
Reviews.Author: Jacob S "JHN Live"
Reviews.Content: I have recently downgraded from iPhone 4 to LG GU295 provided by AT&T.; Since I am using iPad 3G I didn't want to pay double data charges to AT&T.; LG provided by AT&T; is good as a paper weight. I have replaced it twice and was frastruated by the situation. So I decided to spend little money for a lot of peace of mind. I ordered this Nokia C2 from Amazon and oh boy! This is an amazing phone with:Light weightEver lasting battery lifeNokia oVi support (transferring contacts couldn't be easier)Crystal clear soundVery good displayBluetooth ADAP 2.0FM Radio3G compatible with upto 384 kbps (Though I did not test the 3G functions)Overall, if you are looking for a decent phone with extra ordinary battery life to make phone calls ans text, look no further! This is the right phone for you, period!

Reviews.Title: old shoe
Reviews.Author: H.P.
Reviews.Content: great phoneis like putting an old shoe .... strong, comfortable, reliable, useful, does not fail. What more is wanted from a phone?

Reviews.Title: Plug-n-Play travel phone, no fuss at all
Reviews.Author: Gearhead Mania
Reviews.Content: Nokia C2-01 Unlocked GSM cell phone (Quad-band and 3G)I was looking for an unlocked quad-band GSM cell phone for use while traveling abroad. The C2-01 is priced the same as some of Nokia's other smartphones that had a full keyboard (Blackberry style) but the C2-01 was the only one in-stock at the time. I wasn't expecting a whole lot after reading numerous reviews of other unlocked cellphones purchased via Amazon that yielded used/refurbished phones or phones that weren't unlocked.I was pleasantly surprised when the package arrived and my C2-01 was brand spanking new from the factory, complete with a NOKIA factory seal on the box. The battery was new, and the phone was in excellent condition. I was up and running within minutes, and fully charged the battery. I threw in a SIM card from another AT&T; phone and it was immediately working, no PIN or unlock requests, nothing. It immediately recognized the AT&T; SIM card and logged onto the network. I was unable to use the Internet or browse websites though, since I couldn't figure out how to change the access points properly. Even if I figured out how to access the internet, the C2-01 is ill-suited for browsing. The keypad is circa-2001 and the screen is circa-2001. It is very easy to use for phone calls and text messages (albeit slow due to the keypad design), and has MP3 audio capabilities.The micro-USB port allows you to charge the phone as well as access data. The AC adapter works in 120V AC and 240V AC outlets. A SIM card from China Unicom was inserted into the phone while in China, and it immediately recognized the carrier and changed the language to Chinese. The text and menu were in Chinese, this is great if you can read the language while traveling. But this is not so great when you can't read Chinese and just wanted a local prepaid SIM card to use while visiting! However, the simplicity and ease of use made the C2-01 truly worthwhile as a travel phone. The fact it can be used anywhere in the world (quad-band GSM and international 3G) makes it extremely versatile. The long battery life and simple interface for making/receiving phone calls are just icing on the cake!Overall: 4/5 stars. Antiquated keypad and tiny non-touch screen remind me of the late 1990s/early 2000s Nokia cellphones. The saving grace: long battery life, and automatic recognition of prepaid SIM cards makes for a perfect travel phone that can be used almost anywhere in the world.UPDATE: I figured out how to set it up for Internet access and as I suspected, the interface is ill-suited for web browsing let alone modern apps.

Reviews.Title: Good reception
Reviews.Author: . Anne Fischer "Annie"
Reviews.Content: Have had this phone a coupla months.  I use it just as a prepaid phone (tmobile). I don't even text.I don't want a data plan....own a laptop and have wifi, but don't need a phone for computer use though it would be nice.....but data is too expensive for this retiree.Has a long charge and the reception is great....I had a 15 buck motorola renew previously.UPDATE:  the phone texts well and I can even send pictures and all I have is T-Mobile prepaid Sim, which I love!torola renew and that had good reception too--had it for 3 years....so I don't know about the price for this....seems high to me, but everybody else calls it a cheap phone.I like it....the sim card was very easy to install.  Hope the phone lasts me a long time.....I llive in Michigan and am going to Miami for christmas....we'll see about the reception then....although I've called down there and it's alwaoys been good.

Reviews.Title: Simple Phone for Calls and Text
Reviews.Author: xgnx
Reviews.Content: bought phone from amazon 5/23/11. i got the nokia because my old phone was motorzr2 v9 which has a major flaw. the razr will only charge a battery to 1/2 full, because of the phone software.  my phone before the razr was the nokia 6130 and it had a great battery life, but was small for a flip phone. i didn't want a smart phone or a touch screen, i just wanted a phone for calls, texting and that has a decent camera.  i also didn't want to be locked into a contract for another 2 years with AT&T.;the C2-1 so far fits the bill. I can't judge the battery life until i have had the phone for a year or so but everything else is ok.  the phone is smaller than i thought but i can live with that for now. camera takes good pictures, no flash, but you can edit photos so thats cool.  for people who want simple but good, this is the phone.update 3/12/12- i had the phone for over 6 months.  battery life is average, i do not surf the net or take many pictures and i still have to  charge the phone every 3 days, compared to a week or more when i first got it.  i definitely do not store messages or pictures because that just drains the battery faster.  pictures are ok and its easy to hook up the phone to my computer and transfer the pictures i take because you don't need to buy or download a special program to do it.  i would not buy this phone again, but would recommend it an older mom or dad or for a young teen (before they find out about social networking and smart phones).

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Gregory "Gregory"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone as an upgrade from another Nokia phone.  Within minutes of opening the box, I had installed the battery and AT&T; SIM card, and it was up and running.Nokia phones are great.  Excellent reception, solidly built, simple and intuitive controls -- if you're already a Nokia user, there will be no learning curve with going to this phone.  The C2-01 has everything that I loved about my past Nokia phones, but with the added benefits of a good camera and a passable music player.  Also, there are some other notable improvements over past models, like the inclusion of a micro USB port (that can charge the phone from your computer), and a built-in FM radio.You shouldn't buy this phone if you're primarily interested in taking pictures or playing music.  It is, first and foremost, a phone.  But the little 3.2 MP camera does take some pretty good snapshots, and it will preserve memories that you would otherwise have lost because you left your camera at home.The music player is good but not great.  With its 3.5 mm headphone jack, the C2-01 will probably work with your existing headphones.  Songs can be organized by artist, genre, playlist, etc., and even album art is displayed.  It also comes equipped with an equalizer.  The only negative is that the sound quality, in my opinion, is not as good as an iPod or other similar player.Finally, the C2-01 comes with an external port for a micro SD chip (i.e., no having to take the back off the phone to insert it).  With an 8 GB chip, it will hold a substantial music collection and leave room for lots of pictures.I highly recommend this product -- it offers a great deal of quality and functionality for $75.00.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: This phone is great! It has everything you will ever need in a candybar phone and more. The keys are raised so texting is quick and easy. The predictive text is great because you can one hand text and drive. That's right we all do, so why not make it easier with this phone. One of the great features of the phone is the conversation texting. It's great because you can keep up with what was previously said... just like an iphone. Trust me, this phone is great! Touch screens are overrated because you never know which key pushing. Who needs a slider key pad when you have predictive text, that's just one more thing to break. I would recommend this phone to anyone who is looking for a good quality phone without all the gimmicks. This phone gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what should STILL be produced.
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I do quite a bit of international travel. In most countries I love to visit (Philippines, Malasia, Zimbabwe, Zambia) you can land, and in the duty free shop, acquire a local pre-paid sim with a local number immediately. I have AT&T; and an iPhone and it's just not practical to use in these places. In any of these places, there is no micro-sim available that fits most smart phones. Although you can make phone calls on your US-based sim, they cost $5.99 a minute for voice, and $19.99 a kb for data! No typo here...I did that the first time, and had a HUGE cell bill when I returned even with the International Plan.This phone does everything your smart phone will not: Makes EXCELLENT, CLEAR reliable phone calls, battery life is 15 days making a few phone calls, and the battery is user replaceable, and it accepts a full-size sim card. I like my smart phone, but for some reason all the smart phone manufacturers have forgotten its primary role: IT's A PHONE. It NEEDS to make good phone calls.

Reviews.Title: Best phone for Costa rica
Reviews.Author: Pura Vida
Reviews.Content: this phone is really great because it has the best reception in ALL OVER Costa rica, when other phones dont have.you just plug in the sim card and it works perfectly.I am very happy to have purchased this phone. the camara is perfect easy to use.

Reviews.Title: When Phones were Phones....
Reviews.Author: JDS1972
Reviews.Content: Do you long for the days when a phone was a just a phone, with the occassional text message thrown in?  Well, this phone from Nokia can bring you back there.  It has the comforting Nokia interface, with a good build quality and good battery life.  The screen is easy to read with good color contrast.It does the job in a stylish way.  Was just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: great phone and here are the AT&T; mms settings for those of you having trouble still
Reviews.Author: Dr. Daniel Stone
Reviews.Content: so i too had the issue with MMS setting up on my phone...look around and found (see below) all the settings for the phone. one thing i'll say and the at&t; rep at the store forgot was the last step...options activate. i would say also, turn the phone off, wait 30 sec and then on again. should be all set. PS I got two of these phones and did it to both of them right in the store with the at&t; rep watching. he asked if i wanted a job. sorry i just follow directions better is all ; )happy mms'ingMultimedia MessagingMenu > Settings > Configuration > Personal Settings > Options > Add New > Multimedia MsgAccount Name: AT&T; MMSServer address: [...]Use pref. Access pt: NoAccess point settings- Proxy: enabled- Proxy address: wireless.cingular.com- Proxy port: 80Bearer settings- Packet data acc. pt: wap.cingular- Network type: IPv4- Authentication type: Normal- User name: WAP@CINGULARGPRS.COM (all capital letters)- Password: CINGULAR1 (all capital letters)Now go back to the Personal Settings (Personal accounts) > Options > ActivateInternetMenu > Settings > Configuration > Personal Settings > Options > Add New > WebAccount Name: Media NetHomepage: [...]User name: leave blankPassword: leave blankUse pref. Access pt: NoAccess point settings- Proxy: enabled- Proxy address: wireless.cingular.com- Proxy port: 80Bearer settings- Packet data acc. pt: wap.cingular- Network type: IPv4- Authentication type: Normal- User name: WAP@CINGULARGPRS.COM (all capital letters)- Password: CINGULAR1 (all capital letters)Now go back to the Personal Settings (Personal accounts) > Options > Activate

Reviews.Title: Good dumb phone
Reviews.Author: Sooner V
Reviews.Content: I refuse to get on the smart phone bandwagon.  My cell phone bill (with wife and son on it) already costs well over $100 a month.  This phone makes a great, no data plan needed, phone.  Calls are clear.  Ringers are loud.  Interface is simple and easy to use.  Colors are nice and legible except in bright sunlight where they wash out pretty bad.  There are plenty of free themes, wallpapers, and ringtones available.  Changing the volume requires a step or two more than normal but that doesn't bother me.  My one compliant so far is that the screen seems to scuff up fairly easily.  I always keep my phone in my pocket (with nothing else in there) and take good care of it however I have noticed a fair amount of scuffing on the screen.  It doesn't interfere with anything but it is a bit disappointing that it seems to scuff so easily (without this flaw, I would have given the phone 5 stars).  For the price, so far I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: MaracaiboAlterno
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom because she wanted a simple phone that can make simple things like calling and texting and Nokia.This one has it and some other cool features that she loves like the camera, which is OK btw, radio and e-mail service.Best thing in the phone is battery life.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Frank G.
Reviews.Content: Early cell phone users, remember how you loved your Nokia phone? If you don't want a smartphone, maybe you're connected by many other devices in your life, or don't want the cost, this is the phone for you. I use this phone for voice and text and it is great!  It has the great build quality of a Nokia, with menus that are simple, logical and easy to use.  In addition, it easily fits into any pocket as it is truly compact and very light.  And as a bonus when I activated the phone at AT&T; they gave me the sim card!  I look forward to using this phone in Europe.  It is great not to be tied to any cell phone plan and use the phone I want and pay only for what I use!!

Reviews.Title: Works ok, should have kept looking
Reviews.Author: silver
Reviews.Content: Pros:Size - slim and small which is what I was looking for.Looks - nice black with chrome trim.  Flat gray back.Battery life - lasted 16 days on first charge with little use.Screen - nice and vibrant, easy on the eyes.Cons:Call quality - sounds a bit muffled and dull, but is not unbearable by any means.Rare model - so very few accessories like screen protectors, skins, etc. (I'm in the US)Poor FM receptionSupplied Nokia headphones do not fit - they will go in the hole if forced, but a buzzing noise is heard.  You must wiggle them in and out to find that perfect fit to get rid of the buzzing noise.  Tried two other pair in addition to the ones that came with the phone - all were hard to insert and did not work properly.Video quality - very, very bad.  Probably to be expected with this type phone.  The video looks ok on the phone but if you watch on a computer, it looks absolutely horrible with slow fps and smeared colors.Delicate - see update below.  Damaged on first drop.Camera quality I will rate a 3 out of 10.  It works but you have to keep them small on a pc or it's just too grainy and choppy to look at.The phone does what it needs to do - and if I didn't pay Eighty bucks for it I probably would not have taken the time to complain.UPDATE:  first drop resulted in screen losing several hundred pixels.  They form the shape of several ovals on the screen of missing pixels.  I found a replacement screen for $20.

Reviews.Title: Nokia has always made the best feature phones
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: ...and this one is no exception. If you are looking for a phone but do not care for internet use or apps, this is a sturdy one with good battery life and build quality. It does have 3G, a web browser, music player, 16GB microSD slot (card not included), and a camera. All are usable and entirely capable, however the experience is obviously lacking compared to more expensive (smart)phones. The phone has Ovi maps although no GPS built in. Basically one can carry a map database of the entire world (on a microSD card), although location cannot be determined automatically.Physically, it is pleasant to hold and push the buttons. The screen is not touch. This is a great phone for those who don't need advanced features but still want an aesthetically pleasing and durable device that works everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great phone if you are going on a trip to Europe
Reviews.Author: Original UFO
Reviews.Content: Short of being a full blown smart phone, this little gem has it all; phone, text messaging, links up to personal e-mail, good camera and it's easy to negotiate it's menu.  I bought a prepaid SIM card for TIM in Italy, installed it and all the functions were up and running in a short time.  It's small, lightweight, easy to use and a real value, certainly a lot less expensive than paying for overseas roaming on a US based carrier.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Don Thacker
Reviews.Content: I wanted a basic phone for the purpose of being able to make calls. I have found that the battery lasts for days before needing a charge. Have been able to access cell service in many rural areas with this phone that I had no access to with a prior phone. Call volume is excellent. It was unlocked and I had no problems with my AT&T; account or service after inserting my SIM card.I would highly recommend this phone to those in search of something other than a smartphone.Doc, from Ohio

Reviews.Title: Just a simple phone
Reviews.Author: Laura A. Di Tomasso
Reviews.Content: I wish people didn't assume everyone wants a smart phone.  This is a good phone, simple, light and has more than I need.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the international traveler
Reviews.Author: Matt McClaskey
Reviews.Content: I had two phones on a trip to Oman, this and a Samsung. The other phone's battery lasted a lot longer (5+ days instead of 3+ days), but this phone always worked. It never dropped a call, unlike the Samsung that was dropping calls left and right, even from the very same location. Don't expect it to be very smart, it is a very basic phone.The instructions specifically state not to use the full size SIMs with the cut out to make them a micro, but I did anyway because there was no other option and it worked fine.

Reviews.Title: Its a phone
Reviews.Author: mingle
Reviews.Content: Does the job is compact and able to hear it when it rings, my problem is with the carrier not the phone

Reviews.Title: Small
Reviews.Author: keepingitreal
Reviews.Content: This phone is so small, it could get lost in my palm!  LOL  We were not able to use the phone so we sent it back and ordered another one.  I have always loved Nokia, and I am sure it is a good phone for someone who like very small phones.

Reviews.Title: Good so far-- See below for AT&T; configuration instructions
Reviews.Author: Larry Kuttner
Reviews.Content: I just received this phone this week, and so far it seems quite good.  It has better reception than my five year old Nokia which it has replaced.  Best of all, I was able to backup all my contacts from my old phone and import them into this new one using the Nokia PC Suite which is downloadable for free from the Nokia website.  My only complaint is that the product documentation does not include more detailed explanations.Swapping the SIMM card from my old phone, it was easy to get the phone itself working, however configuring the Internet settings for use with my AT&T; service was difficult. Some reviews here were helpful, but not enough. After much searching around, I found these instructions on the AT&T; website for the Nokia C3 which has similar configuration options.Carefully following these instructions got Internet connectivity and the Opera Mini browser working, though for some reason the Nokia browser which also came installed still gets an error, but it's redundant anyway.Follow-up Note: Amazon automatically blocked a few settings that were URLs [..], so do a search for "Nokia-C3-MMS-and-Web-settings-SOLVED" to find the complete info.Multimedia MessagingMenu > Settings > Configuration > Personal Settings > Options > Add New > Multimedia MsgAccount Name:  AT&T; MMSServer address:  [...]Use pref. Access pt:  NoAccess point settings-  Proxy:  enabled-  Proxy address:  wireless.cingular.com-  Proxy port:  80Bearer settings-  Packet data acc. pt:  wap.cingular-  Network type:  IPv4-  Authentication type:  Normal-  User name:  WAP@CINGULARGPRS.COM  (all capital letters)-  Password:  CINGULAR1  (all capital letters)Now go back to the Personal Settings (Personal accounts) > Options > ActivateInternetMenu > Settings > Configuration > Personal Settings > Options > Add New > WebAccount Name:  Media NetHomepage:  [...]User name:  leave blankPassword:  leave blankUse pref. Reviews.Title: Nice feel, easy to use, with some useful features
Reviews.Author: John E. Pugh "Pughimag"
Reviews.Content: I like this phone. I have been a pre-paid user for some time because of the low cost (approx. $12/month or so). My last phone finally died and so I purchased this unlocked phone from Amazon (Their delivery was terririfc). I was able to start using the phone right away and to my surprise it has a radio built in which is a great bonus. I was able to listen to my favorite radio station as I went to lunch today. My last phone had a touch screen that didn't work too well so I am loving this phone, navigation and entry is handled via keys on the phone - yeah!It handles a mini SD card and can do alarms, voice recording and has a 3.2 Mega Pixel camera on board. It also has a loudspeaker.All in all just a great phone so far. From what I've read the battery life is very good, we'll see but I'm sure it will be as good or better than my previous phone which was an LG phone (GD510 I believe). I am not a smart-phone user because I have an iPad and the cost of the service for a smart phone is too much for my taste.I took a star off because I found it difficult to remove the back, the power connector is a little flimsy and it's not obvious to me yet how to turn down the beeps and sounds. I know I am supposed to use the joystick control for volume but it doesn't always work. Also, I'm not sure if I can load songs from my PC yet.

Reviews.Title: Works Great for Travel with Roaming SIM card
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: I use this for travel in Europe.  It's a goodphone.  A friend bought one also for the samepurpose and I bought it on his recommendation.We're happly with the phone.

Reviews.Title: teléfono nokia c-2
Reviews.Author: luis
Reviews.Content: Buenos días, con este teléfono no tengo problemas con las tres operadoras que se encuentra en mi país Venezuela, a pesar que es económico funciona bien y a mi hija le gusto mucho.

Reviews.Title: nokia unlocked cell phone c2-01
Reviews.Author: excellone
Reviews.Content: Nokia C2-01.5 Unlocked GSM Phone with 3.2 MP Camera and Music and Video Player--U.S. Version with Warranty (Warm Silver)Nice small phone for basic phone operation and small pictures.  It worked with my Costa Rican Kolbi card and has good battery life.

Reviews.Title: Solid Replacement
Reviews.Author: James J. Wang
Reviews.Content: This is a good phone for those that just want to make phone calls for the most part. Nothing fancy, but when you buy this I don't think you expect to have it do all the smartphone things. That being said, it is a reliable phone with great battery life, call quality and is easy to use.No flash lightOnly gripe, is to get the time when it is locked, press the hang up (red) button. I stumbled onto that, I don't think the manual had that. And the time is shown in a grey (doesn't look black to me) and the background is blinding white. Also time doesn't stay for more than a second, other ones usually last longer as long as you hold the button.

Reviews.Title: Solid phone
Reviews.Author: Anonymous "lima_1"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap phone with bluetooth and which works in the US and in Europe. This was the cheapest I could find (without doing a proper research, I admit). The 3G feature makes only sense in countries where you get cheap (email-only/slow) data plans. If you spent 50 bucks a month for a data plan, obviously buy a proper smartphone.  The phone has a classic, nice look, but feels a little bit cheap-it's all plastic. You probably can't expect more for 80$. Good thing is, this makes it a very lightweight phone.The software is the result of a weird and long evolution. For example, you have at least 5 different places for shortcuts and menus (the normal menu, a short-cut bar, the home screen, the go-to menu, and you can put functions on the left- and right-button). All of these can be reconfigured, which means once you get used to it, you can access every commonly used feature with at most 2 clicks. The standard NOKIA theme is ugly, but the phone ships with an elegant dark theme. So far, it sometimes crashed while gaming, but otherwise it seems to be quite stable.  The games (Sudoku, a brain training thing, something like Tetris and a neat game of skill where you build skyscrapers) are not too exciting, so not really an issue. The phone is much faster than I was used to (had a 5+ year old NOKIA) and things happen almost instantly, except starting apps.Someone complained that synchronizing does not work with Mac OS, but  just google it, you can create an iSync plugin very easily (address book and calendar work nicely).  So overall, solid phone for everybody with a prepaid SIM card and without a data plan. If I could, I would trade the 3G and the camera for a better and thinner case. That phone would have gotten 5 stars easily.

Reviews.Title: Calls, music, and more + Easy SIM interchange, ...
Reviews.Author: UT
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a phone (i.e., a device basically for phone calls, as opposed to a hand-held computer).  I was pleasantly surprised by the Nokia C2-01, because the SIM from my old Motorola [originally a Cingular(!), then AT&T;, and finally a converted prepaid T-Mobile, after unlocking it] - anyway, taking the SIM out and placing it into the C2-01 was seamless/easy.Because my old phone was useless and the phonebook could not be retrieved, using the Nokia Ovi software (downloaded from their web site) made the process a little less painful - inputting the contacts from a keyboard is easier than doing so directly into the phone.  The Bluetooth wireless was then used to transfer the information from a laptop to the C2-01; I did not have a micro-USB interface cord, which would have been faster.  Also, I used Bluetooth to transfer about 1,000 songs from the same laptop via PC-based iTunes (downloaded from Apple) - for the money, its music function is great, as is the quality of calls.The Nokia C2-01 is more than adequate for anyone wanting a pre-paid phone that can be used in the USA or Europe.  Otherwise, if one wants additonal services from either AT&T; or T-Mobile - that will run more $'s, of course.  I only wanted a conversation phone, but the additional functions of the C2-01 are welcome, although I am not making full use of them.The display is very readable; the menu system is just fine for a better-than-basic phone; calls are clear.  The buttons are easy to use and accurate.  I chose the "warm silver" color - it seemed like a "brighter" choice to me than black.From Amazon, I also ordered a side pouch belt case by BestCellBuy [Amazon had this on sale for $0.99(!)]; and a protective gel skin by iTALKonline - fits perfectly with little additional girth.I am quite satisfied with the Nokia C2-01; and with Amazon's product selection and shipping/handling service - free shipping and no sales tax (Woohoo!).See this link:  Nokia C2-01 Unlocked GSM Phone with 3.2 MP Camera and Music and Video Player--U.S. Version with Warranty (Warm Silver)

Reviews.Title: does the job right...
Reviews.Author: R. Perez "lado oscuro"
Reviews.Content: Update: March 2013, since I first reviewed it this phone is awesome still works and now I have given it an additional star, please read more to know why I gave it 4 stars the first time.Original Review:This is a replacement from previous phone that had screen cracked since i could not find a phone that was to MY LIKING in my local area I came to amazon.----------SHORT Review: Purchased June 2011, a great phone for a good price, use it as a phone not an mini computer. Great memory expansion and it does work with AT&T; and T-mobile.----------LONG review: I found this one, order it and arrived sooner than expected, charged the battery and inserted SIM and made some calls and texts to try out, it works super no problems UNTIL I got to play and explore it more some days later; the settings are not hard to get but just takes times to figure out. It has some apps (facebook, email, nokia store etc...) that you can use but I don't need them so I'll skip that. Thou you can find the same items in the Gallery and Media menus it gets annoying because you don't need to have different locations for the same things could same the space and relocated into one.The MINUS ONE STAR, I am disappointed in three things that I found messed up after I got to explore this phone more; 1.) the alarm clock is only for one time and can't set it for different wake-ups all other tools I found were OK. 2.) can't get media message (pictures) on this phone so far I can browse the net but can't receive/send pics like my previous phone 3.) my carrier charged me for the data that was used for the free game i downloaded from the nokia store since I was not aware the phone would be using data while playing the game, that was my fault so I just set that to DO NOT ALLOW anymore and now I can play without having the phone use up data. I don't have a data plan to begin with.It is plastic and you DO NEED to protect it, I got a protective case and so far I have drop it more than once till this day it works nice, NO DROP CALLS so far. Battery life is average, screen is clear the buttons easy to use, I was scare that they would get damaged but so far THIS LITTLE GUY HAS DONE ITS JOB RIGHT.

Reviews.Title: Good price Good simple phone
Reviews.Author: Evelyn Case
Reviews.Content: This phone has been good for my very simple needs.It's small and light and holds a long charge.I don't use it for anything other than calls and texting.The screen is too small for emails for my tastes.If you're looking for a simple unlocked phone, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Good basic phone
Reviews.Author: geeky1
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to downgrade from a smart phone to a dumb phone for some time. My iPhone 3GS had been dropped on its head one too many times and I knew it was not long for this world. Not wanting to have it die on me and be rushed in to a purchase (my cell is my only phone), I decided to research some simple phones and found that this one got the best reviews on many sites when compared to others in this price range. Where I live I only get good reception from AT&T; and I wanted a pre-paid plan. Most if not all of the GoPhones (while cheaper) got poor reviews for sound quality and construction. Mind you, I was just wanting a phone to talk on and I did not plan to text, check email, or use any type of data at all, so this was a good choice for me. I have read that folks who want to use the data features have run into trouble when trying to connect, but I can not speak personally on this issue.I have only had it for about a three days, but so far, so good. To get it up and running I charged it, took the sim out of the iPhone, and put it in the Nokia. I immediately got a signal and all I had to do was spend a frustrating hour on the phone with AT&T; migrating to a pre-paid plan (my choice- I could have just dropped the data plan and kept my post-paid acct, obviously).  Since that first charge the battery icon shows only one less "bar" than full, and I have had it on the entire time. I like the look, size, and feel of the phone. The sound quality is good and I find the user interface simple to navigate.  It came with plenty of ring tones and the simple one I chose is nice and loud so if I leave it on the table near a window I can hear it when I'm out working in the yard. Someone else mentioned that there is no dedicated button for volume control, but I knew that ahead of time and I have not found it to be a problem. It's just a few key presses to put it in "silent" mode for theatres, meetings and such, so no worries.I will say that when I tried to copy my contacts from sim to phone, it said my sim was empty. I don't honestly know if this was because the contacts data was in some smart-phoney format that my new dumb phone could not read, but I really don't care all that much. I had actually begun to worry that I didn't memorize anyone's phone number anymore because all I ever had to do was touch their name... I had gotten very iLazy. Indeed-- when asked recently I could not recite my own son's phone number! I consider that I am doing my brain a favor. Of course I could enter them manually, and it is possible to sync contacts, music, etc via Windows (or Mac with an iSync plug in) but I have not tried this and am not likely to any time soon. My old iPhone is now my new iPod touch that stores all my music as it always has, and I have gone back to memorizing phone numbers (starting with my son's).In conclusion, if you are looking for just a phone without a lot of bells and whistles, I recommend this device.

Reviews.Title: Good Old Nokia
Reviews.Author: BittenAgain
Reviews.Content: It works well as it has always been the case with Nokia products.  Smartphones are not for me under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: great reception
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Corbran
Reviews.Content: i like a phone that calls people, with no need for interent or texting or anything else really, this phone is great.i always have more bars than my girlfriends iphone :)

Reviews.Title: review of cell phone
Reviews.Author: Walter J. Heikkila
Reviews.Content: The quality of voice receiving and talking is good. The screen size is good but the keypad is much too small and the numbers, letters against black are almost not visible.  For this price, you would think to have a keyboard like a computer for sms.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: ranon suarez
Reviews.Content: very attentive to the item, shipping came the day scheduled in good condition. Recommended 100% and there were no problems with the purchased item

Reviews.Title: Costa Rica Phone
Reviews.Author: New Englander - Route 95
Reviews.Content: Perfect phone to use with Telestials International Phone Card.  See my review of cheap extra batteries that will allow you to never need to recharge while travelling ....just pop in a new battery!  (obviously you need to charge them up before your trip)

Reviews.Title: Fm radio requires use of a headphone
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: I was dissappointed  in the cell phone as the FM radio feature requires the use of a Nokia headphone.Some cell phones of Nokia's competitors do not require the use of headphones. Amazon website did not state that the FM radio feature required the use of headphone, so I had assumed that it did not.  I did not return the item to  Amazon because i had already left for overseas when I realized that a headphone would be required. Amazon/Nokia should not omit such detailsfromtheir product description.

Reviews.Title: Built to last.
Reviews.Author: dan
Reviews.Content: This is a feature phone that does the job, is loud for calls, easy to use and will last years.  Its a workhorse, plus it looks cool.

Reviews.Title: Low voice
Reviews.Author: ycyash
Reviews.Content: The voice on this phone is very low. You have to push the phone very close to your ear to hear clearly.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Rodney Prante
Reviews.Content: I've found the C-2 to be an excellent value. The phone fulfills my needs quite well. Just drop in the sim, charge up the battery and go. I live in a rural area and have found the reception to be great. The only criticism would be the small size and tiny buttons might make it a poor choice for the ham fisted.

Reviews.Title: Good unlocked GSM phone
Reviews.Author: Graham Shaw
Reviews.Content: Phone is relatively simple to use and set up.  Works fine with our European sim cards. No problems with the phone out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Joyner Padrón
Reviews.Author: Magallanero
Reviews.Content: Todo salio muy bien, el envio se hizo correcto al dia establecido y el telefono en perfectas condiciones!!! 100% recomendado. Agradecido!!!

Reviews.Title: Nokia C2-01.5 Unlocked GSM Phone review
Reviews.Author: Chris Toliver
Reviews.Content: The unit has worked very well in both Chinaand in France. You might want to getthe dual sim version which this is not.

Reviews.Title: Love my little phone
Reviews.Author: Irina
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice basic phone. I use it for phone calls mostly, alarm clock and few text messages. It has been a good experience so far as always with Nokia. Messaging is a little confusing or not as user friendly as on iPhone or HTC. But I don't use it that often so no problem

Reviews.Title: Great for what you pay
Reviews.Author: Big Rope
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone for work. I only get calls to this phone, so I don't need a lot of features, bells, or whistles. I walk around an old, brick building most of the day, and I get darn good reception most of the time. Most other phone fail in the darkest corners of my office building, but not this little guy. Plus, it is unlocked and has multiple antennas inside, so it works with most GSM frequencies. Would highly recommend, as long as you only need it for the occasional phone call!On a plus side; solid build quality, easy to use and navigate, very reliable device

Reviews.Title: Nokia C2-01 great cellphone
Reviews.Author: KM of VA
Reviews.Content: This Nokia cellphone does what it was advertised for...I just need a phone with no frills just something to use in calling. Works well with T-mobile pay-as-U-go. Got it at a good price too (under $85).Simple features with practical use. FM radio is a big help when you need to hear about traffic or weather when you are riding a public transportation.

Reviews.Title: Functionally simple and user-friendly!
Reviews.Author: Gerald Esquivel
Reviews.Content: Great battery life, simple features for every practical use... this is one of the best of Nokia! It's size and weight is just right for me.

Reviews.Title: Perfect phone for me
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: This phone has all the features I need at a reasonable price.  Here are some of my favorites:Size - Small enough to easily fit in your pocket.Battery life - Very good.  I can usually go about 5 days between charges.  Previous phones I have owned usually lasted about 3 days.Camera - It takes very nice pictures if the light is good and you hold it still.Data - It is easy to connect to a computer with a micro USB cable (not included) to access the microSDHC flash memory card (not included).  I recommend buying both a micro USB cable and a microSDHC flash memory card when you buy this phone.Samsung USB Home Travel Charger with Detachable Micro USB Cable for Galaxy S 4G T959V, Vibrant Plus, Vibrant 4GAmazonBasics 8 GB microSDHC Class 10 Flash Memory Card with SD AdapterButtons - The buttons have a nice feel.  They are good for the occasional text message.  The predictive text works pretty well for typing with only 10 keys.Media player - You can load MP3s on this phone and play them through the included earphones.  It also plays FM radio.  You can also select MP3s as ring tones.Charging - Charging can be done using the included adapter or through the micro USB cable.Compatibility - I use T-Mobile pre paid.  I put my SIM card in, and the phone worked right away.  It will not send pictures, but I have read that you can contact T-Mobile to enable picture send if you want it.  Since pictures cost $.25 each to send, I choose to keep this feature disabled and upload any pictures directly to my PC.Nokia Suite software - This is my only complaint about this phone.  This software is confusing and difficult to use.  It will allow you to put some extra games on the phone, but many of the games will not work without a data plan.  Downloading music and backing up the phone is not intuitive.  The software needs a Windows Explorer type interface to show you exactly what is on the phone, and it needs a simple copy & paste feature.  It also does not provide access to data on the SIM card, so you cannot get a simple list of your contacts.Overall, this is a great replacement for the old phone that came with my T-Mobile pre paid plan.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Tanaman "chainmaster"
Reviews.Content: This phone was just what I was looking for.  A basic phone that could also play music.  The screen was smallish but clear and bright.  The phone had a good solid feel and sharp looks in spite of some plastic parts.  It was easy to navigate through the functions.  I got this in the US and then took it with me in Sri Lanka where I now live.  I dropped in a local sim card and was making calls within a minute.  No adjustments needed.  I did turn off 3G mode as I do not have a data plan in SL and I think 2g mode uses less juice.  Data plans are offered and I presume this phone would work with them, as it has 3G.  I just don't need that nowWhat was great was when I connected it to my computer to install music into the 16gb microSD card that I also purchased, windows media player quickly recognized it and allowed me to drag and drop music files within windows media player.  It synced quickly and I was out the door with a full set of music.  Best of all, I did not have to use iTunes, which is so cumbersome by comparison.So...great simple candybar phone that sounds clear and has extra functions if you need them.  In 2g mode battery lasts for days.  Sadly someone recently stole it from me in Delhi so now I'm back to my 5 year old Motorola, which still works like new.

Reviews.Title: Solid Performance - Works on AT&T; - Voice and Texting
Reviews.Author: Patrick Noel
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone to replace an aging Nokia that was close to 10 years old.  Swapped the SIM card from old phone to new and instantly connected to the AT&T; network.  Phonecalls and texting worked fine.  Have not yet tried to text a photo.  Camera functions fine with good quality.  Added micro-SDHC card.  Connected phone to PC and copied pictures over.  So far, so good.Amazon delivered ahead of schedule.  Phone in use now for about three weeks.

Reviews.Title: good and not so much money
Reviews.Author: crazy for printers
Reviews.Content: it has all that I want in a phone and I like that it is not tied to a phone company...I bought this one and got it and tried it out ... it worked so good I bought a second one right away for my wife.

Reviews.Title: Basic Phone - No multimedia for ATT
Reviews.Author: Bogey
Reviews.Content: My wife always loved her old Nokia phone due to the strong basis functions. The phone works great as a phone and probably does multimedia great with other services. AT& T does not sell this phone and therefore does not support it. This phone with AT&T; cannot receive or send pictures via multimedia which if I had know would not have purchased the phone. This is not Nokia's fault it is an AT&T; problem.  Would gladly buy another Nokia phone if it would work with AT&T.; My wife needed a low cost phone due to being outside her renewal period and we felt this would be a good solution. If you have AT&T; service and want to send multimedia messages don't buy this phone.

Reviews.Title: Phone review
Reviews.Author: Dotress
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone, long lasting battery, had a smartphone which I got rid of for this one, much happier with this.!

Reviews.Title: Very good team
Reviews.Author: Milemnys R. Guerra "Milemnys R."
Reviews.Content: Very good team because it was Amazon who buy it .. The only thing I dislike is that Nokia does not include accessories like USB cable only includes: charger and battery ..

Reviews.Title: Best value for money - Nokia
Reviews.Author: Sreenath H B
Reviews.Content: I needed a basic bar phone for rough and tough use. No better device than a Nokia for that. Plus its a quad band US version phone. Which means it works on all networks in the US and should work everywhere else in the world too. For the price paid, couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: gbs
Reviews.Content: Was a little skeptical at first, but the phone worked great.  Used in Guatemala for the first time, no problems with sim card and both voice and sms were flawless.  Great battery life as well.  Only minor complaint is the instruction booklet was difficult to understand and once the sim card went in, the phone was totally in Spanish... but minor issues for a terrific little phone.

Reviews.Title: Much smaller than I imagined
Reviews.Author: Glenn Johnson
Reviews.Content: Very nice product. Good volume, easy to hear with nice look all in a compact unit. Good buy with great quality.

Reviews.Title: internet and apps too hard to use...
Reviews.Author: HWinVA
Reviews.Content: The phone is fine as such, but I paid for a phone that works on the internet.  The internet and associated apps are hard to set up on AT&T.;First of all, as you might imagine, AT&T; has no idea about this phone.  However, there are only two GSM carriers in the US and there are oodles of phones, so I can understand their situation.It ought to be up to Nokia to provide easy-to-find instructions about how to set up the phone with the only two carriers that have GSM and on which their phones work, that is, AT&T; and T-Mobile.  Falconcc has a review dated April 20, 2011 that has information that might help you, as it helped me, although I can't make all the entries he suggests; at this point, some of the apps don't work.  But I do have basic internet now as well as the phone and text messaging.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with AT&T; data plan
Reviews.Author: Marcus Censor
Reviews.Content: Please be advised that this phone will not allow you to connect to the Internet or to use any of its data features like email etc. if you are using AT&T;'s data plan. You can however make calls and send SMS text messages. I learned this the hard way and had to return what was otherwise a decent phone.

Reviews.Title: Nokia C2-01.5
Reviews.Author: bre
Reviews.Content: Like that it is unlocked & easy for us older ones to use & we could use it for our AT&T; plan.The 2 things you NEED to know though.  # 1-You have to set it to ran the internet.  It was easy for my 25 year old. He told me what to do.  Where I went wrong was ask AT&T; to help. I went through 3 people trying to set it up, and they said IT WOULD NOT work on AT&T.;  And chewed me out for buying from someone else!  Do NOT call your phone company to get it set up.! It was easy and they could not or would not help.# 2-The Car Charger (CLA) for Nokia  is not in this box.  This is where I got mine  [...]  .They do have it here though http://www.amazon.com/Rapid-Charger-Nokia-2865I-VI3155/dp/B002AQX9T6/ref=sr_1_10?ie=UTF8&qid;=1365509935&sr;=8-10&keywords;=cell+phone+car+chargers+Nokia

Reviews.Title: Good Value for a Basic Phone
Reviews.Author: A. Frantz
Reviews.Content: The Nokia C2-01.5 is a pretty basic phone when compared to the plethora of smart phones on the market. It's also quite good as a basic phone.Cons: The interface is simplistic, and lacking in many regards. It's not a good phone for frequently sending text messages, though I don't use it for texts so that wasn't a concern. It's a bit too light weight and small, and slippery to hold. Importing contacts was a bit annoying, and I ended up importing them into Outlook to mate with the Nokia software, but it does sync with Outlook for calendar and contacts as well as with some free email software options. There's no wifi, though I doubt many people will be using this phone for surfing the web, but that means the 3G is mostly useless because if you wanted to pay $30 a month for a data plan you probably wouldn't be looking at this phone.Pros: It gets a solid signal. My connection is better now than possibly any phone I've used on Verizon or ATT, including the iphone 3gs, blackberry bold 9000, and droid x(1). It's clear enough for voice, especially considering the price point, but nothing to brag about. It's international ready, and works very well for me on ATT. Bluetooth connects quickly. Battery life is exceptional compared to a smart phone and many basic phones of past; you will immediately notice that you're free of carrying around a charger all day if you use it as just a phone. The price is fair. It can be charged off a USB (not included) or wall charger, and accepts a micro-SD card if you need the storage. It uses a standard headphone jack for audio, including FM radio, so there's no need to have a proprietary connector. It can sync to a computer using bluetooth.Overall: If you're looking to use this phone for the 3g data, you'll probably be disappointed. It would be better to purchase a used smartphone of ebay/craigslist. If you text a lot, this is probably not the phone for you. If you're looking for a phone to be used as a phone, this is an excellent option. It's inexpensive, it's internationally ready, it gets a good signal, and it has good battery life. I would use some sort of a rubberized case if you expect it to get banged around or it might slip out of your hand frequently; it's a bit awkward to hold because of the size and shape.

Reviews.Title: muy buen producto.
Reviews.Author: angelox
Reviews.Content: compre este teléfono liberado para un regalo, es excelente, acepta cualquier linea aquí en Venezuela, digitel, movilnet, incluso trabaja 3g con movistar. buena cámara, fácil manejo, diseño agradable, botones rápidos a redes sociales, le coloque una SD de 4GB pero aguanta hasta 16GB, me recuerda este teléfono al clásico 6276 Nokia, pero con tecnología de punta, funciona con mensajería express OVI.... lo recomiendo.

Reviews.Title: nokia c2
Reviews.Author: Astrid
Reviews.Content: Es un excelente telefono, le coloque el sim card de linea movilnet funciona perfecto, el unico problema es el audio del telefono, a la hora de recibir una llamada la calidad es baja en cuanto al sonido ya que suena muy bajito y ya tiene todo el volumen del auricular. por lo demas un excelente telefono

Reviews.Title: re:Nokia C2-01
Reviews.Author: cwhite
Reviews.Content: As for talk quality (isn't that what a cell phone is really supposed to be all about), this phone worked well. Nokia in my view has the best reception as well. The battery life was just ok. Very typical.  I did however return this phone. This was the second C2-01 that I had purchased.  Both had defective ear jacks. (That was a must have on my list of needs) The scroll bar across the bottom was a plus. It can be customized though a couple of the apps can not be removed. i.e. Facebook and I think the OVI store. For the price and the fact that this is an UNLOCKED PHONE (hallelujah), this phone is very nice.

Reviews.Title: NOKIA MP3 CELL PHONE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: RICH
Reviews.Content: The Nikia C2-01 Unlocked GSM phone with 3.2 MP camera and music and video player is a good product...  Simple to use...  Just slip in your SIM card and start calling....  Take a 16 GB microSDHC card for storing your music/photos/videos...  The camera seems to be good...  The sound on music play back is good on speakers and with ear buds/phones...  Worth the price...  It will do even more then I use it for...  I am sure it doesn't have the bells and whishles that an I-Phone/Pad has...  But then it is about one fifth the price...  4 stars...

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased with this item
Reviews.Author: Deokie Narine
Reviews.Content: This item was purchased for someone who had a similar one years ago and wanted one just like it again. It is an upgraded version and the person is very pleased with the phone.

Reviews.Title: Works well!
Reviews.Author: Love to read
Reviews.Content: Nice phone. Takes great photos. The battery lasts a long time. Haven't been able to figure out some things like how to get the photos off it. But overall I'm satisfied with it. Nice ring tones too.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE NOKIA'S
Reviews.Author: Lesley Ann
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone over 2yrs now I live in the #Caribbean, I never had a problem with the purchase, it works really great, I thought buy now it would have started to malfunction but it hasn't, I bought it for my hubby and he is in need of and upgrade yes it is gonna be another NOKIA... SO LET'S TALK ABOUT THE PHONE THE CAMERA IS CRYSTAL CLEAR, THE PHONE WORKS GREAT IT NEVER STICKS, IT HAS NO WI-FI THE BLUETOOTH WORKS REALLY GREAT, THE PACKAGING WAS AWESOME.... I DO RECOMMEND THIS PHONE FROM THIS DISTRIBUTOR. 5STARS FOR U... BOTH PHONE AND DISTRIBUTOR.

Reviews.Title: Battery No Good!!!
Reviews.Author: Nokia Fan
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone and I had to return it because of the battery!!!! The battery needs charging after every 7-9 hours I have never a Nokia like this since Nokia started selling phones. I ordered this one here in Houston, Texas and I have one simple Nokia phones that I bought in dar es Salaam Tanzania, Yes in Africa, that is far far better phone than this!!! So Nokia if you read this work on improving the battery otherwise the phone is real good. I replaced it with Nokia Asha 300 and the batter hold the charge for at least 2 days before recharging. This what we expect from Nokia.

Reviews.Title: A phone forea life time use
Reviews.Author: Rodoy Munoz Peralta
Reviews.Content: Good shape. Brand new and perfectly package.  Came on time. At the moment, works perfectly and it full feels all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: excellent phone
Reviews.Author: Damata
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone. What brobe buenisimo in Venezuela and works with all carriers, good camera, very easy to husar. I like Nokia phones for its strength and durability. I recommend

Reviews.Title: adaquate forwhat I needed in Costa Rica.
Reviews.Author: kathryn serra
Reviews.Content: Good price for the value..clear and strong.. keyboard a bit small for texting..easy prompts but too many for some functions

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: Juan Miguel
Reviews.Content: Very good phone, very good performance and durability. exclente price.I recommend it for anyone who wants to have the basics and not much internet browsing

Reviews.Title: Jenny
Reviews.Author: Dorada
Reviews.Content: I got it a good time. i recommend this phone is to easy to use, for examples for my mom was the best.

Reviews.Title: Reliable simple phone
Reviews.Author: qball
Reviews.Content: Needed a simple, reliable phone for my technically challenged parents.  Set them up on a pay as you go plan with tmobile.  Phones work great.  Parents no longer on ridiculously expensive phone plans.  Problem solved .

Reviews.Title: My new phone
Reviews.Author: L Macuro
Reviews.Content: My new phone.  The Nokia C2-01.5 is a old model but a good phone. I like it because it is easy to handle

Reviews.Title: I bought this phone to replace an older Nokia brick phone.
Reviews.Author: AnnaM
Reviews.Content: This worked great, though it was not as sturdy as my old Nokia brick phone that had had for seven years prior to buying this. This phone served me well for two years as a good PHONE. It's not good for much else, but if you want something cheap and unlocked, this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: A fine phone, but...
Reviews.Author: kcskeele
Reviews.Content: it's a european phone.  So if you wanna use it in the states, you won't be able to send or receive picture messages.  At least that was the case on AT&T.;I wouldn't have gotten it if I'd known this would be the case.

Reviews.Title: A good quality phone
Reviews.Author: Matthew A. Todd
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone for about 6 months or so, and am pleased with it overall.I think the voice quality is good for the most part, although perhaps not as good as an old POTS landline. However, I do find that the volume on the standard speaker doesn't go up high enough. It's almost impossible to hear my mother and girlfriend when using it (they often talk softly) and can occasionally even have trouble hearing my dad (who doesn't talk as softly.) So I often use the speakerphone instead, which has a much better volume range. It's for this reason that I knocked down the rating a star.I have no other complaints with the phone, although I pretty much only use it for calling. Occasionally I'll send / receive a text, but not enough to comment on it.

Reviews.Title: Nokia C2 unlocked
Reviews.Author: Peter Paula
Reviews.Content: It is a very good phone for a lady. It is small and has camera, slick design. For my hands it is too small. The reception is not that great and often the phone will loose signal whereas the older Nokia I use just holds on to the signal. Because of this I took one star off. If you want good small unlocked phone and have good signal where you live, this is the phone for you. I use it with the microSD card. Battery life is not as good as my old Nokia, but it uses the same battery. I wonder why the batter life is not as good as with the older phone and the reception is worse. Could it be the operating system?

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Charlie Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Great basic phone for texting, calling, and simple. It is for someone looking for a smart phone alternative. A good buy.

Reviews.Title: Products excellent quality
Reviews.Author: Jose Gutierrez "rajofasel72"
Reviews.Content: all well the product arrived as always recommend everyone can buy with confidence and without fear of all products offered are of good quality origanales

Reviews.Title: nice simple cell phone
Reviews.Author: Jordean
Reviews.Content: It's a Nokia, so it's sturdy. I was disappointed to find that it had no Chinese character set in the system. Maybe you can find one online but installing would be a project. So it's a nice, simple phone and that's that. Battery life is much better than a smartphone, and the display is quite bright.

Reviews.Title: Good, basic phone.
Reviews.Author: M. Barnett
Reviews.Content: Compact phone with good battery life, both in use and in standby. Voice quality is about average for cell phones these days.

Reviews.Title: Solid phone for those not wanting a smart phone
Reviews.Author: Majka
Reviews.Content: I wanted a phone that wasn't a smart phone, but at the same time wasn't dumber than my first phone I bought 15 years ago. Many of the non-smart phones available through my carrier are so simplified they are nearly useless. This one retains the ability to be customized to some extent, has things like multiple alarms and a calculator (the T-mobile phone I bought had none of this), and has a great battery life, good call quality, and a fairly decent camera on top of it. The only down side is the reception, which while very good, is not as great as my ancient LG phone had in some places. Texting can feel a little cramped in the beginning, but I was able to adapt surprisingly fast. I had a little trouble with receiving MMS but a quick trip to the T-mobile store sorted that out. No trouble using this overseas or switching providers when needed for basic call and txt functionality. Data can be a bit trickier but never something that the providers haven't been able to resolve. And really, this is not an iphone, this is a great solid phone from a few years ago, before the smart phone craze hit.

Reviews.Title: satisfied buyer
Reviews.Author: sangean buyer
Reviews.Content: good reliable phone for overseas travel.  It is not fancy with whistles and bells of newer phones but just right for travel and calls.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: kat
Reviews.Content: Great phone but I returned it because I thought it was not worth the price. I am sick of my iphone (gasp) and want something basic that I can text and talk with. I don't think this will be great for texting without a proper keyboard. Don't need all the other bells and whistles and seriously, how much time each day do you spend staring at your smart phone?

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Francois K. Pirayesh
Reviews.Content: I use this phone when i am in China is great easy to use and fits in your pocket.I recomend this product.

Reviews.Title: Functional and modern
Reviews.Author: Lilia
Reviews.Content: It's a great basic cellphone, just made for people with no need to keep connected to Internet all day long. It's features like camera, mp3 playing and a full color screen make it still a modern phone. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Can't Receive Multimedia texts

Reviews.Title: all perfect

Reviews.Content: hello very good morning. many thanks for your services. is a new experience for me that I am outside, and I had never purchased abroad, the product as new even though the shipments curier to uncover what to revise, but everything else was excellent, really original products, is better than I expected thanks for your treatment and care, your score earned positive all of you, I know it is safe to buy from here, the take this into consideration for my upcoming purchases next year, greetings from Venezuela friends

Reviews.Author: tim
Reviews.Content: Simple, small, light.  I've taken the phone abroad with no problems.  This phone plus PTel is a steal when compared to any contract plan I've seen from the major networks.

Reviews.Title: nokia c2
Reviews.Author: simo
Reviews.Content: Firstly there's no place like amazon. This phone is perfect for the none gadget person yet it has a lot of interesting features. I love it

Reviews.Title: Great simple phone to make phone calls
Reviews.Author: Afshin
Reviews.Content: I've bought this for my international sim card. I just want to be able to receive phone calls while traveling to North America. I wish it were a bit cheaper (that makes it a 4 star) comparing to similar devices from Nokia's competitors.

Reviews.Title: Works well

Reviews.Content: Bought this phone to replace an older Nokia phone. So far the phone works great and it's easy to use.

Reviews.Title: gud

Reviews.Content: great for those that don't have much to do with phone. good for texting and making calls. I didn't check the internet before I sent it to Nigeria for old folks lol.

Reviews.Title: Good basic phone.
Reviews.Author: Phillip Kan
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my mom. All she needed is a very basic phone for emergency call. She prefer button instead of touch screen. I wish the screen can be an inch bigger.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Basic Phone
Reviews.Author: Gene Bolles
Reviews.Content: I ordered this phone for my wife to use, she didn't want voice mail, email or texting. The sound quality is great and the phone is easy for her to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Hari
Reviews.Content: This phone worked without any glitch when I used it in India. Good call quality and worked great right after getting new SIM card.

Reviews.Title: Excellent

Reviews.Content: Great, the best undoubtedly brought everything indicated by the publication, is great quality, has exceeded my expectations. Great buy. From Venezuela recommend

Reviews.Title: Love this small phone
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Gillie"
Reviews.Content: Came in a timely manner. I set it up and it perking especially the radio even though I had to get powerful headset to get a stronger feed for the radio. Other than that is is a great product and i will definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for Travel Abroad
Reviews.Author: PhotoChick
Reviews.Content: I needed a basic unblocked cellular phone for communication while traveling through Italy and this phone worked beautifully!!! I bought a SIM in Italy and was able to communicate with friends and family in Europe as well as in the United States. Reception was super clear, battery charge lasted a substantial amount of time, and I was able to take photos to send to family members. I would recommend this phone to anyone who wants a basic phone at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Basic phone for people that has no need for smart phone
