Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my mom since she has no need for a smart phone...she like the style of the phone and it is light weight...easy to use....the only con it has no volume buttons on the side of the phone to adjust volume

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Essohanam Essizewa "E.E"
Reviews.Content: Very small works well and fits anywhere.....My mom loves it and will recommend it to all who are interested

Reviews.Title: Great "stupid" phone
Reviews.Author: Peanut
Reviews.Content: This phone replaced my old Nokia only because my carrier is longer supporting a 2G network.  My only complaint is that it goes through the battery a whole lot faster than my old Nokia. It has all of the same great features that Nokia has had in their past phones (the capability to personalize the phone applications), as well as some new very nice features (the option to have a analog clock, music, and camera to name a few).  Love this new phone and plan on keeping it for a long time!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: jasy35
Reviews.Content: Great phone, simple to use, has very long talk & standby batteries. The Noxia site is very useful to download music, apps, etc,

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: brenda
Reviews.Content: its a good phone for the price and very easy to use.i would highly recommend it t anyone who likes Nokia phones

Reviews.Title: Fairly Easy To Use
Reviews.Author: Peabody Shortbread
Reviews.Content: This cell phone is fairly easy to use if you're not too much into technology, and I think it is a fairly reasonable option to use internationally if your standard cell phone plan is generally limited to the U.S., Canada, and Mexico.

Reviews.Title: Excellent phone
Reviews.Author: James Lerager
Reviews.Content: This phone is small, light-weight, easy to use, and functions faultlessly. It also has excellent signal range. Good camera for a non-smart-phone. Battery life is superb, lasting days of heavy phone use per charge, unlike smart phones that need constant recharging. I set up the phone so that only the phone, address book, and camera are quickly accessible - no distractions. If you don't need or want a Smart Phone, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: The right phone if you don't need a data contract (but you could have it)
Reviews.Author: A. Pucciarelli
Reviews.Content: I needed a sturdy normal phone because I don't have a data contract with t-mobile, and this guy fitted perfectly: I just needed to slide in the sim card and everything ran smoothly. The only configuration I needed to input was the one for the multimedia messages that I've found on internet.It's working from 3 days, and one day in a place with almost no signal, and the battery shows more than half full while with my old HTC Diamond, with large battery, I couldn't arrive at half of the second day.The phone is arrived in a sealed box in really no time at all, so I am more than happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: low cost equals low performance
Reviews.Author: Asdrubal Prince
Reviews.Content: the screen is very small as the size of the letters, even in the larger option, making it difficult to read. Is a phone for young

Reviews.Title: returned it
Reviews.Author: Autounion
Reviews.Content: Would not read my ATT sim card it said registration error so I think it was not unlocked sorry just did not work for me to bad cause the phone was nice though......

Reviews.Title: Good phone, one flaw.
Reviews.Author: Robert Carling
Reviews.Content: Good replacement for my Nokia 2700, which stopped working. Almost the same phone, therefore easy to use immediately. The only flaw is a very poor display of signal strength, charge level, time of day--all very tiny and bunched at the top of the screen, and no setting that allows changing the visual format.

Reviews.Title: SAFE WITH NOKIA
Reviews.Author: Sheldon Noray
Reviews.Content: This is small but packed with features. If you are looking for the something simple, high quality, and feature filled this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: Nokia C2-01.5 Purchase Experience
Reviews.Author: Beverley
Reviews.Content: The recipient of the phone, truly is in love with the product.  This is the second time he's had the brand in less than a year - the first one worked like a charm, but unfortunately was stolen.  It's a great buy for the features, and I would certainly recommend it to anyone interested in a small, versatile phone.

Reviews.Title: more than a simple phone
Reviews.Author: Erhard
Reviews.Content: this phone is quite amazing with the built-in FM radio (good reception) and full blown MP3 player with equalizer. also plays videos. i also checked out that it accepts 32GB micro SD card - that is really very good.also allows to play music over bluetooth ( i did not check this one)the speaker phone and voice quality are really good (nice to listen to radio or MP3 without headset.so if you do not need a smart phone this one is a very good alternative.it is slightly bigger than the C1-02. also the C1-02 has a nice soft feel on the plastic but the C2-01.5 is clearly more powerful and costs about 2x

Reviews.Title: Not fancy, just what you need
Reviews.Author: Rachel Daly
Reviews.Content: I was looking to replace a previous nokia candybar phone, and discovered this one. Charged it up and put in the sim card, the display is nice for the size, the hand set speakers works well, and the microphone can pick-up really well. Nothing fancy just a good upgrade for a phone that was a few years old.

Reviews.Title: Simple and reliable PHONE
Reviews.Author: Alexander V.
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone over a year ago and have never had even a minor problem with it. I chose this phone because it is:-compact-fit any pocket size-famous Nokia battery life-real buttons, no touchscreen-unlocked, works on any GSM network anywhere in the world-drop it, wet it- no problems- if you brake it- just get another oneI still believe that a phone should make calls first and do other thing second. If you need high quality phone to make calls anywhere in the world, from muddy forest to Europe to Asia, if you are not dependent on the Internet, if you don't have to impress anybody (in order to impress somebody get Nokia's upscale Vertu, $5000 for the cheapest one) you will like this phone.Bluetooth works perfect. Radio has decent reception although is not on par with real radios. Camera: very good picture quality/ very poor video quality. Microphone, speaker- great. Buttons- good size, easy to dial. Email- easy to use, I used it few times while traveling abroad. Internet- sorry, I've never used the phone to surf it. Battery life- you can charge it once a week.Negatives- the screen will be scratched if you don't protect it. I didn't but the phone still works :)If you are one who uses phones to make a statement C2 is perfect for you:"Look I don't even have a smartphone!". Such a statement is even more powerful if you make it while sitting behind the wheel of $50k car :)

Reviews.Title: Surprised by the poor manufacturing
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: I'm a Nokia fan & I bought this phone for my partner. Within a month, she was complaining that the glass screen had become loose. I am disappointed 'cos I have never associated Nokia with poor manufacturing standards.

Reviews.Title: Good phone with plenty of features
Reviews.Author: tm
Reviews.Content: A good choice for an unlocked phone.  Not a smart phone but provideds access to web, email twitter and can have almost the same usability.  Gets four days out of a charge

Reviews.Title: Feels very plasticky
Reviews.Author: NP
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as a replacement for a lost phone. It does function very well for somebody who just needs a basic phone to make and receive calls. The phone is very light and feels flimsy. It was dropped once (from about 3-4 ft) and the LCD has permanent damage on it.

Reviews.Title: C2 from Nokia
Reviews.Author: RA
Reviews.Content: Great candy bar phone and works with the GSM carrier SIM I chose.  A bit on the pricy side, however, it still looks like one of the best in class

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: amazing practical and easy to use, combined with great technology. this phone is a good purchase! i bought it for my mom and she really enjoys using it

Reviews.Title: This candy bar is sweet
Reviews.Author: Dr. Jay
Reviews.Content: I've had this c2-01.5 for a year. Slipped in a SIM card from an old TMobile flip phone that broke, and I was in business.  I only use it for voice and text though it supposedly does email.  The camera is better than I thought - when I finally hooked up the USB cable and uploaded the pictures to my PC I was quite surprised at how much better the pix are than  on the phone's tiny screen.  I have a smartphone too, and an iPad, but THIS is the phone I still carry everywhere, even after a year of use and buying a nifty smartphone.  It's Nokia tough and the battery lasts  forever and I can dial the keypad by feel  without seeing it if I ever had to.  Trusty reliable and classic,  and the Nokia 4 frequency GSM combo works worldwide in my experience,  I've just pulled it out and dialed home in Europe, Middle East, Africa and Asia (watch the roaming costs or else put in a local SIM card  of course.)  I just can't give it up.  So my smart phone sits at home, or I take it along also, for it's classy camera,  but the c2-01 will be the one I always have on my person  and will till it falls apart.  Actually I bought a spare, so I'm good till  they quit making SIM cards.

Reviews.Title: Good for a backup phone
Reviews.Author: rmmccann
Reviews.Content: Having recently switched to a prepaid cellphone plan using a SIM card, I wanted to have a backup phone in case I had an accident with my primary $400 smartphone. After a lot of searching, I came across the Nokia C2-01.5. I didn't want another smartphone as a backup due to costs; I just wanted something capable of sending/receiving calls, texts and mms as well as having MicroUSB charging support so I could continue to use my other phone chargers (I have about 6 of them). For the price, this phone fit the bill and also had the added bonus of 3G (HSDPA) support on ATT's network.I picked up one of the "Used - Like New" items for a discount. The phone came in mint condition with all the accessories and manuals. It powered on and worked great, however there is one small annoyance (one that I suppose I could get used to) - the screen itself is skewed about 10-15 degrees to the right, so it's essentially "crooked" when powered on and held normally. This doesn't affect any of the functionality of the phone, but it looks really strange and makes you do a "double take" when looking at the phone and using it. Because of this obvious build quality issue, I couldn't give it more than 3 stars.As far as signal strength and other features, this phone does as advertised. Pictures aren't anything fantastic and the screen (as well as the phone itself) is very small, although perfectly functional. All in all, for a phone I plan to use as a backup it will still work perfect.

Reviews.Title: This post is about setting up a Nokia C2-01 on the AT&T; wireless network.
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: So, this phone is NOT an AT&T; phone.  I bought it on Amazon.com for under $100.  At any rate, it boasts internet connectivity, email, app store, MMS, etc.  However, since it's not an AT&T; phone, it does not come pre-configured to connect to the AT&T; network for using these services.SO, HERE ARE THE THREE STEPS REQUIRED TO GET THIS PHONE GOING:Two of the Steps are configuring Access points, found under:Menu > Settings > Configuration > Personal config. sett. > Options > Add New >I will refer to the path above, as AP_HOME.1.  Configure Web Access PointGo to AP_HOME and choose Web and set it up as followsAccount name:  MediaNet (or whatever you want it to be)User name: (blank)Password: (blank)Use pref. access pt [Yes/No] (no)[If No] Access point settings -Proxy [Disabled/Enabled] Enabled-[If Enabled] Proxy Address wireless.cingular.com-[If Enabled] Proxy Port 80-Data bearer [Packet data/GSM data] Packet data -Bearer settings Packet data acc. pt: wap.cingularNetwork type [IPv4/IPv6] IPv4Authenticiation type [Normal/Secure] NormalUser name: (none)Password: (none)2.  Configure the MMS Access PointGo to AP_HOME and choose Multimedia msg.Account name: MMS (or whatever you want)Server address: http://mmsc.cingular.comUse pref. access pt [Yes/No] No[If No] Access point settings-Proxy [Disabled/Enabled] Enabled-[If Enabled] Proxy Address wireless.cingular.com-[If Enabled] Proxy Port 80-Bearer settingsPacket data acc. pt: wap.cingularNetwork type [IPv4/IPv6] IPv4Authenticiation type [Normal/Secure] NormalUser name: WAP@CINGULARGPRS.COM (all caps)Password: CINGULAR1 (all caps)3.  Set the default Access PointTo do this follow this pathMenu > Settings > ConfigurationIn configuration, choose Default config. sett.Choose "Personal config" and the middle button will now say "Details," so click the middle button.The middle button will now say "Default," click the middle button again.Congratulations, we just used the internet to solve a problem.

Reviews.Title: Excellent small phone, if you know how to service it yourself...
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I bought mine at a Nokia store overseas.  After a couple of months it would not ring when a call came in.  AT&T; said, "Sorry, but you didn't buy it from us so we can't help you." Nokia's U.S.A. unit told me the same thing. When I took it back overseas, the Nokia repair place wanted to keep it for two days.Here is how I fixed it myself:1. Save all phone numbers to the SIM card, because this procedure will wipe out the phone memory!2. Select "Settings," scroll all the way to the bottom, and select "Rest. factory sett." to restore factory settings.3. Select "restore all," press "continue" and enter code: 123454. Let it do its thing for a minute or two.Then it was like new again with all its original ring tones!  :^) If you do this procedure in the U.S.A., it offers the opportunity to receive messages from Nokia that I'm hoping will allow me to take advantage of additional features of this phone. You can always opt out of those later.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: Jorge Polanco "JP"
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for a relative. still has it since jan 2012. still work great, have no issues and very fast enough. as for the camera it takes decent pictures during day. but at night u need a well lite area. Also like the quick apps on the screen that you can customize. recommend this economic phone to anyone. who is not look for a expensive phone.

Reviews.Content: I recommend the product and the seller , good price for a great nokia cell phone , that's is the nokia phone that I was looking for

The only problem was setting up the MMS configuration for AT&T.; Here is what worked for me.Menu > Settings > Configuration > Personal Config Sett. > Options > Add New > Multimedia MsgAccount Name: AT&T; MMSServer address: [...]Use pref. Access pt: NoAccess point settings- Proxy: enabled- Proxy address: wireless.cingular.com- Proxy port: 80Bearer settings- Packet data acc. pt: wap.cingular- Network type: IPv4- Authentication type: Normal- User name: WAP@CINGULARGPRS.COM (all capital letters)- Password: CINGULAR1 (all capital letters)Now go back to the Personal Config Sett. > Options > Activate

Reviews.Title: A good basic phone
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: This phone does exactly what I wanted. It gives me the ability to use the phone anywhere in the world simply by putting in a local simm card. Good battery life and the volume is excellent. The only drawback so far is that the phone is very slick so it is easy to drop if you're not careful and I occasionally inadvertantly dial a number when it is in my pocket. I have ordered a skin for it which I hope will alleviate those problems as well as help protect the phone should I accidentally drop it. If you need texting capability look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: cm
Reviews.Content: I like the phone very much! Great basic; will do all I want but not too much. I can handle this one!Thanks

Reviews.Title: very good

Reviews.Content: Very pretty smart and tough, I hope to continue shopping at amazon, nokia in my country is very cozy, country Ecuador, all in pretty good order, the packaging of the cell, one that should send packing boxes smaller .. please, there isn`t micro sd, incluye micro please

Reviews.Title: A good cell phone
Reviews.Author: Abderrezak
Reviews.Content: A very good cell phone for calling and text messaging with a good camera. The battery life is good but not as strong as describe ,especially if you play games. If you are looking for a good cell phone with simple features I will recommend this device to you.

Reviews.Title: Efficient Nokia Phone
Reviews.Author: Laura-Anne E. Clarke "LAC"
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my Aunt who is over 70. This phone allows her to make calls,  text and take pictures which are her main needs. Great phone at an economical price.

Reviews.Title: Good as I expected
Reviews.Author: vv
Reviews.Content: This is a good product on its price. The delivery speed is great. The font and format of the words look very comfortable on the phone. It has four language choices that I can use Spanish, French and Chinese if I want. That is excellent!

Reviews.Title: Nokia C2-01 Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: Richard J. Crissinger
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this phone it was a good price and saved me from having to renew a contract with my provider for a year just to replace my old worn out phone. All I had to do was take the SIM card out of the old phone and put into the new phone and charge the battery and I was good to go. I don't need all the features on the new phone but for the price I couldn't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Love this basic phone
Reviews.Author: TGray
Reviews.Content: This phone is terrific for someone who wants a basic phone that is efficient, with great battery life. The interface is easy to use, it came with the charger and all documentation and has been a pleasure to use.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding simple phone!
Reviews.Author: IronBuddha
Reviews.Content: If your someone who only uses a cell phone for calls and maybe a few texts here and there then this is definitely the phone for you. 3.2 mp camera takes decent pics, navigation through everything is a breeze. MP3's, ringtones, wallpapers etc. are very easy to do. Just add them to the micro sd and insert it into the phone and that's it.If you're looking for something simple that doesn't break your wallet, I highly recommend checking this one out.

Reviews.Title: Not charging
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for a friend,I started to charge it and receive a message saying"charger is not supported", i decide to use the micro usb cable,because i knew it can be charged this way,the same message pop up on the phone,so my only conclusion,the phone is defective."Amazon Verified Purchase,"

Reviews.Title: awesome phone
Reviews.Author: konrad1225
Reviews.Content: very nice phone. sleek and sturdy design, very easy to personalize. speakerphone is loud enough. reception is also awesome. perfect phone for calling and mesagging. idk about internet - im not using it :).

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Slicjk two
Reviews.Content: This is a basic phone just what I wanted,with a few bells and whistlessuch as a camera FM radio that is not too complicated to use.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: TheChosenOne
Reviews.Content: I have always been a nokia fan and I ordered this item after seeing the features. When it arrived, was disappointed . Its made of cheap plastic and very flimsy.It is difficult to key in the number on this phone, forget about texting.The volume is low.The Camera resolution is not good . I earlier had a sony Ericson W760a with the same 3.1MP camera and the sony phone takes much better pics compared to this nokia. Its definitely not worth the money. will get better phones for the same price. Would not recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone with one major exception
Reviews.Author: Doc "User 101"
Reviews.Content: My I-phone finally bit the dust (3G) when I dropped it one time too many, so I wanted an inexpensive, functional phone until I decide whether to buy another Smart Phone.  This phone works very well and fills all my requirements with one exception which falls into the "what were they thinking" category.  There is no way to reduce the volume of the ring externally.  One has to go into the menu and then settings to change the volume.  Call volume can be changed in the midst of a call, but changing the ring volume is not exactly easy to use if I want to silence my phone before entering a meeting or a movie.I would probably return the phone, but all other features, including the sound quality are so good that I will put up with this design glitch.

Reviews.Title: Basic phone
Reviews.Author: B. Kibler
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone because my Android phone was accidentally run through the washing machine, ruining the touchscreen display.  Until my contract comes up for renewal, I needed a basic low-cost phone to get me through the next few months.  I also wanted an unlocked phone, because I do occasionally travel overseas, and like the ability to use a pay-as-you-go SIM for cheap local calls.As a long-time (pre-Android) Nokia candy bar phone user (my 8890 still works!), I was instantly up and running with basic phone calls and SMS texting on this phone.  The decade-old navigation habits work just like they always have, while new features are intuitive and simple use.  The Opera Mini browser is too small to be useful, but it works in an absolute pinch.For GPRS/Internet connectivity, I followed the simple AT&T; instructions for Nokia S40 located here:att.com/learningcenter/tutorials.do?tutorialId=763520&_requestid=620564#fbid=hbp8i4LW5ByThese instructions were much simpler than those posted in the top-rated review.For contacts, I got all my Google contacts to automatically sync following the simple instructions located here:support.google.com/mobile/bin/answer.py?hl=en&topic;=15015&answer;=98265The one feature this phone is missing is a GPS and the ability to run Google Maps.

Reviews.Title: poor interface, compatibility
Reviews.Author: Phil Loubere
Reviews.Content: I'm on page 51 of the manual trying to look for a shortcut for a silent setting, and one to set it back to normal. An intuitive interface would have put these basic functions in an obvious place, but I had to flip through 51 pages to find out that if I want that functionality, I have to set up my own shortcuts. Other things, like locking the keypad - which is essential on this phone - are also arcane: push the menu button, then star. If you're not familiar with Nokia devices, it's a combination you'd take a long time figuring out on your own.What these indicate is that interface design is typically an afterthought instead of a prime consideration. This is why the iPhone is so popular - they started with the interface and designed the device around that. At Nokia, they do that in reverse order.So, in spite of the nice range of functions in such an inexpensive phone, I give it minus points for that. Camera, facebook, IM and internet all have icons on the home screen, but completing tasks with them can also get confusing.The other disappointment with this device is its lack of compatibility - not only with Macs, but even with Windows XP Pro if it's 64 bit. So it doesn't work with the two OS's I happen to use.As another reviewer pointed out, it would be great if Nokia would just focus on a handful of devices and made those really good, instead of the hundred or so models they produce. For the inexpensive price, this is certainly good as a phone, but not much else if you don't have compatible devices or don't want to read the 84-page manual.

Reviews.Title: I Waste My Money
Reviews.Author: Jaskaran Singh
Reviews.Content: i don't like this phone, its wroste then ever.I Totally Waste My Money.Please Don't Buy This.Don't Waste Money.

Reviews.Title: Nokia C"-01.5
Reviews.Author: mafalda100
Reviews.Content: It is the classic one. I bought it for my mom. Simple and easy to use. I recommend it 100%

Reviews.Title: Works fine
Reviews.Author: Benniegirl
Reviews.Content: Its gift for my elderly mother and she loves it so far. Cos she can easily see the numbers on the keyboard. Its jus a regular phone to call, text and check emails not surfing the net. If that's what you want in a phone, then this is a deal. Recommended any time. Also it had a 2gb micro sd in it.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: Pictures were average to poor.  Texting was difficult if your hand is anything bigger than a teenie bopper.  I didn't think sound quality was exceptional at all.  I've owned Nokia before and was happy, but wasn't impressed about anything with this phone.  Not worth it.  Have iPhone now.

Reviews.Title: Great cellphone product
Reviews.Author: Morse13
Reviews.Content: I bought it for a recent trip to Europe and it works great without any issues. I was very pleased surprised when the package arrived and brand new from the factory, complete with a NOKIA factory seal on the box. The battery was new, and the phone was in excellent condition. I was up and running within minutes, and fully charged the battery. I inserted in a SIM card into a phone and it was working immediately, no PIN or unlock requests, nothing. It immediately recognized the SIM card and logged onto the network. It is very user friendly for phone calls and text messages and has MP3 audio capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Nokia C2-01.5 Unlocked GSM Phone with 3.2 MP Camera and Music and Video Player--U.S. Version with Warranty (Black)
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: Nokia C2-01.5 Unlocked GSM Phone with 3.2 MP Camera and Music and Video Player--U.S. Version with Warranty (Black)  Got this for my Chinese SIM card. It arrived on time and works well.

Reviews.Title: no se puede usar las redes sociales
Reviews.Author: tedys
Reviews.Content: sbueno si funciona ensegida que le coloque la tarjeta sim funciono a la perfeccion. lo unico malo es ala hora de configurar la pagina de inicio de internet. todavia no he podido hacerlo y por esa razon no he podido entrar a  las redes sociales

Reviews.Title: I give it 3 stars
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: Lack of the on-screen-display date. To find what is today, one would have to search through several steps, the old man who received my gift has returned it to me due to that simple reason.It was just too complicated for him to look for today's date.

Reviews.Title: very small phone
Reviews.Author: Tanvir khan
Reviews.Content: bought this phone few days ago & returned it same day...this phone may be good but the camera is very bad...not even 1 mega pixel.(but it says 3mp)..& the phone is so tiny,,,,,,overall I didnt like it.....

Reviews.Title: Fine but not smart
Reviews.Author: James Stallings
Reviews.Content: I returned the two phones because my wife and I decided they were not smart enough.  This is not a complaint as the phones were exactly as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Languges in the phone
Reviews.Author: Amir
Reviews.Content: does this phone have Arabic languge ?? I need to know so I can buy it or not..Please someone respond fast.

Reviews.Title: Not pleased
Reviews.Author: Victoria
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone for my fiance because of all the great reviews and because he didn't want a smart phone...boy was this a big mistake.  This phone claims to be "unlocked" but does not work well with AT&T; (maybe it's a better phone with other providers but I would not suggest getting this if you have AT&T;).  We spent a lot of time trying to reconfigure the settings to get the internet and sending pictures to work but it was all for not.  The bad does not outweigh the good with this purchase and I would strongly advise against it.Pros:Small/compactLightweightBattery LifeCons:Connecting to the internetSending picturesTexting

Reviews.Title: Favor...
Reviews.Author: Margot
Reviews.Content: hello i just ordered this phone and i wanted to know if its possible for you to send it as an used or personal item i will appreciate it.. thanks

Reviews.Title: frustrating!
Reviews.Author: novice
Reviews.Content: I love the phone, it does just what I want it to do, easy to use, pictures are good, SIM cards switch easily.  But less than a month after I bought it, the battery charges, says it's full, then 5 minutes later is empty.  What's this all about?  A faulty phone?  A battery gone wrong?  I thought Nokia was supposed to be a good, dependable product!  What ever happened to making things last for years and years?FRUSTRATION!!!

Reviews.Title: poorly designed, cheaply built
Reviews.Author: A sad Nokia loyalty
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my mother because of its simple design, US waranty and 3G compatibility with AT&T;, but above of all, my faith in the brand. The left side soft key always stays in after being pressed, and the only way to pop it back up is by pressing the right side soft key, like playing a see-saw. I wanted to say it's just my bad luck, but I feel the problem is more likely caused by a poor design and cheap parts.Being a Nokia phone user for 16 years and counting, with good memory of my 6188, 6230, 8800, E65, 5530, C6-01, I can't express how sad I was when holding this piece of thing in my hand.I had to return the phone. Amazon processed the return smoothly, as expected.

Reviews.Title: dissapointed
Reviews.Author: cornel
Reviews.Content: Battery not in a seal pack ,probably used ,don't last the full charge more than one day.Just one alarm ....incredible.

Reviews.Title: SIM card regisstration failed message on ATT
Reviews.Author: ForexTech
Reviews.Content: Not sure if or why this phone does not work on ATT network. I called ATT support and we tried several things but the phone would not connect to the ATT network to register the SIM card. SIM card worked fine on another unlocked Nokia phone. Don't know if the phone they sent me was bad or if this phone is just not good.

Reviews.Title: USED PARTS INSIDE. THE WORST EXPERIENCE
Reviews.Author: Jwpperez
Reviews.Content: i GOT THIS PHONE IN ECUADOR 1 MONTH AFTER THE PURCHASE. IT WORKS GOOD FOR 2 MONTHS, BUT AFTER THAT IT ALWAY GIVE PROBLEMS TO ME. I SEND IT TO REVIEW IN A AUTORIZED CENTER BUT THEY TOLD ME THAT IT HAS USED PARTS. NOW IT DO NOT WORKS IT IS A FRAUD.

Reviews.Title: Boring and Buggy
Reviews.Author: Ryzeldorf "Ryzeldorf"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone as a replacement to my 2730 which was fairly new but got dropped on concrete. I was very happy with my 2730 for the price but when I see the year over year lack of innovation going between what should be two versions of the same phone, it depresses me. Nokia was once the king of cell phone innovation and now is just plane boring. The software used to update and manage the phone (Ovi Suite)is clunky and a resource hog. It's trying to copy the usefulness of itunes but is very poorly built.The reason I wanted to perform the software update was the annoying sound of my own voice that comes through the earpiece. This is a little hard to describe. The microphone is very sensitive and live yet it drops in and out. I can't figure out what's going on in my ear when I try to talk, but its very annoying. Its not like a network delay and echo that you hear but a real-time loop. Nokia is a great example of good being the enemy of great. They had a nice market share and decided to sit on their laurels while others passed them by.Avoid!

Reviews.Title: a pain just to open back cover
Reviews.Author: wings
Reviews.Content: smooth and thin design, but i can not write a review because i am unable to slide back cover to load battery. am afraid i may damage it if i apply force in doing so.
